course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot more about policy analysis, which was very useful because I wasn't familiar with that type of writing previously. Specifically in the way that policy analysis is a combination of political theory, economics, science, and overall understanding. I think it was also very helpful to learn more about the application of this knowledge in a shareable and often focused context whether that be in an analysis of a specific person or the form of discussion posts or the form of a podcast. It was all great! Lastly I think that I learned a lot about how to recognize that all sides have a reason and that none should be ignored for that reason.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This class was the only non-STEM class I took this semester, so taking this really gave me an opportunity to develop analysis and writing skills. I definitely understand the energy sector far better now and feel more prepared to analyze policies in the United States.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about how policy at mostly the federal level impacts the US's progress in the renewable energy transition. Specifically, the Inflation Reduction Act helped me gain a better understanding of how a policy plan can have a drastic effect on our energy sources. I also learned about how foreign policy has impacts across economic and resource-related sectors. I gained an appreciation for the work done by smaller businesses and governments towards making this transition possible.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

response_text:
I learned about how interdisciplinary policies are to account for various effects in different aspects of life
I learned about media literacy, especially when it comes to energy and policy, so I feel more confident reading articles about current events in these fields.
I learned about how fluid careers are and how much can change even after you have graduated and entered the work force. I learned this through the various guest lecturers who recounted their journeys.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: First, I learned about the general structure of the current energy system, including the ways that energy is currently produced, transmitted, and harnessed around the world. We learned why it is this way, and the benefits and drawbacks of the current system, including climate change. We learned about how the energy system is related to policy and the economy. Later in the course, we dived into the idea of the energy transition, why it is happening, and what current policies are fueling it. I learned to think about energy, and other issues, with a wider lens that does not just include my feelings on the subject.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructors facilitated a very interactive learning environment that allowed everyone to participate and present ideas. I also liked the fact that they brought Ben Abram, a CEO of a private-sector company, in to co-teach this class, as it gave a different perspective on the topics that I otherwise wouldn't have been able to get.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The discussion component of class was very beneficial; I was forced to seek out articles on relevant subject matter and engage in discourse with my classmates which helped me gain new perspectives. I also think the essay-writing was beneficial for me as an independent assignment because both my writing and critical thinking skills improved. I think the overall grading system should be kept in place because it ensured each student a fair chance regardless of their incoming background.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the open discussions, there was a lot of class participation which kept it interesting. I also really enjoyed the guest speakers and how different each one was.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the weekly discussions, as well as the Policy Analysis framework assignments. I would have added at least one final paper check-in, however, to keep everyone at a good pace and force people to have an instructor check if their paper was going in the right direction. I enjoyed the conversation-based classes and the guest-speaker led lectures. Those were very engaging and interesting.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved the structure of the class overall. We began with heavy lectures that introduced us to the fundamentals and important aspects of energy. Then we had a variety of different speakers with very different positions and experiences coming in and giving us insights. I think that these were wonderful opportunities for us to learn from, especially for students new to the space like me.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Having three professors was definitely one of the greatest strengths of the course given the variety of expertise we were exposed to from individuals in different backgrounds studying the same issue, as well as the accessibility and support that came with a low student to teacher ratio. I also would highly recommend maintaining the style of an information-heavy first half of the class, and an exploration-centric second half (guest speakers, projects, etc.).

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really liked how this course included a mix of lectures with background information, and guest speakers from Duke and beyond. I thought this format really helped solidify my understanding of key energy policy concepts while expanding my horizons to the broader implications of energy and ways that I could get involved with the sector in the future.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.
question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
The class was discussion based, and the entire time the students were free to ask questions or comment on the current topic. This made the class very interactive which helped provide great context for the subject. Dr. Brian Murray is an incredible teacher, largely because he is very knowledgeable about all parts of energy, with particular specialties in energy policy and economics. He brought in a lot of guest speakers with very different roles and opinions on energy, which made the class different every day. 
In the future, the course should definitely keep Dr. Murray and his style of teaching, and the guest speakers.

course: ENERGY-178FS-01 : ENERGY POL FOR CHANGING WORLD.ENERGY-178FS-01.

response_text: I HEAVILY recommend this course for anyone interested in energy and learning about the energy system. It provided a great baseline understanding of energy that will propel anyone interested in energy into a future in the subject. This was an incredible way to start my learning experience at Duke, and a true privilege to learn from someone as distinguished as Dr. Murray.
